intro: Hibiscus submonospermus, commonly known as the yellow hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with five petals and a prominent central pistil. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Hibiscus submonospermus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
